translation.text: The Guru instructs His wandering Sikhs;

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: if they go astray, He sets them on the right path.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਤਿਸੁ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਿ ਸਦਾ ਦਿਨੁ ਰਾਤੀ ਦੁਖ ਭੰਜਨ ਸੰਗਿ ਸਖਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: So serve the Guru, forever, day and night; He is the Destroyer of pain - He is with you as your companion. ||13||

transliteration.text: tis gur sēv sadā din rātī dukh bhanjan sang sakhātā hē .13.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਗੁਰ ਕੀ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਹਿ ਕਿਆ ਪ੍ਰਾਣੀ ॥

translation.text: O mortal being, what devotional worship have you performed to the Guru?

transliteration.text: gur kī bhagat karah kiā prānī .

translation.text: Even Brahma, Indra and Shiva do not know it.

text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਅਲਖੁ ਕਹਹੁ ਕਿਉ ਲਖੀਐ ਜਿਸੁ ਬਖਸੇ ਤਿਸਹਿ ਪਛਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: Tell me, how can the unknowable True Guru be known? He alone attains this realization, whom the Lord forgives. ||14||

transliteration.text: satigur alakh kahah kiu lakhīai jis bakhasē tisah pashātā hē .14.

translation.text: One who has love within, obtains the Blessed Vision of His Darshan.

text: ਅਹਿਨਿਸਿ ਨਿਰਮਲ ਜੋਤਿ ਸਬਾਈ ਘਟਿ ਦੀਪਕੁ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: Day and night, the Gurmukh sees the immaculate Divine Light everywhere; this lamp illuminates his heart. ||15||

transliteration.text: ahinis niramal jōt sabāī ghat dīpak guramukh jātā hē .15.

text: ਦਰਸਨੁ ਦੇਖਿ ਮਿਲੇ ਬੈਰਾਗੀ ਮਨੁ ਮਨਸਾ ਮਾਰਿ ਸਮਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੬॥

translation.text: Beholding His Darshan, the unattached one meets the Lord; subduing the mind's desires, he merges into the Lord. ||16||

transliteration.text: darasan dēkh milē bairāgī man manasā mār samātā hē .16.

translation.text: Deep within each and every heart, they recognize God.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਹਰਿ ਜਸੁ ਹਰਿ ਜਨ ਕੀ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਦੀਜੈ ਜਿਨ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਹਰਿ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਜਾਤਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੭॥੫॥੧੧॥

translation.text: Please bless Nanak with the Lord's Praises, and the Sangat, the Congregation of the Lord's humble servants; through the True Guru, they know their Lord God. ||17||5||11||

transliteration.text: nānak har jas har jan kī sangat dījai jin satigur har prabh jātā hē .17.5.11.

text: ਆਪੇ ਕਰਤਾ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਵੇਖੈ ਸਾਚਾ ਵੇਪਰਵਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: He Himself created the creation, and beholds it; He is True and independent. ||1||

text: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਨ ਹੋਈ ਸਚੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਜਪਿ ਲਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: Without the Perfect Guru, no one is liberated. Chanting the True Name, one profits. ||2||

transliteration.text: gur pūrē vin mukat n hōī sach nām jap lāhā hē .2.

translation.text: They take bribes, and give false testimony; the noose of evil-mindedness is around their necks. ||3||

text: ਵਿਣੁ ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਤਤੁ ਨ ਪਾਈਐ ਸਚ ਸੂਚੇ ਸਚੁ ਰਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੪॥

translation.text: Without the Perfect Guru, the essence of reality is not obtained. The true and pure beings walk the Path of Truth. ||4||

transliteration.text: vin gur pūrē tat n pāīai sach sūchē sach rāhā hē .4.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: All praise God and listen, and listen and speak.

translation.text: He Himself is wise, and He Himself judges the Truth.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਜਿਨ ਕਉ ਨਦਰਿ ਕਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਅਪਨੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਬਦੁ ਸਲਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੫॥

translation.text: Those whom God blesses with His Glance of Grace become Gurmukh, and praise the Word of the Shabad. ||5||

transliteration.text: jin kau nadar karē prabh apanī guramukh sabad salāhā hē .5.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਸੁਣਿ ਕਹੀਐ ਕੋ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੀ ॥

translation.text: Listening and speaking, no one knows His limits.

transliteration.text: sun kahīai kō ant n jānī .

text: ਜਾ ਕਉ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾਏ ਆਪੇ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਬੁਧਿ ਤਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੬॥

translation.text: He alone is wise, unto whom the unseen Lord reveals Himself; he speaks the Unspoken Speech. ||6||

transliteration.text: jā kau alakh lakhāē āpē akath kathā budh tāhā hē .6.

text: ਜੋ ਜਨਮੈ ਤਿਸੁ ਸਰਪਰ ਮਰਣਾ ਕਿਰਤੁ ਪਇਆ ਸਿਰਿ ਸਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੭॥

translation.text: Whoever is born, is sure to die, according to the destiny of past deeds inscribed upon his head by the Sovereign Lord King. ||7||

transliteration.text: jō janamai tis sarapar maranā kirat paiā sir sāhā hē .7.

text: ਦੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਹੀ ਤੇ ਭਏ ਨਿਰਾਲੇ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੀਲੁ ਸਨਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੮॥

translation.text: The Gurmukhs remain unaffected by pain and pleasure; they wear the armor of humility. ||8||

transliteration.text: dukh sukh hī tē bhaē nirālē guramukh sīl sanāhā hē .8.

text: ਸਚਾ ਵਖਰੁ ਜਿਸੁ ਧਨੁ ਪਲੈ ਸਬਦਿ ਸਚੈ ਓਮਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੯॥

translation.text: One who has the wealth of the true commodity in his lap, is blessed with the rapture of the True Shabad. ||9||

transliteration.text: sachā vakhar jis dhan palai sabad sachai ōmāhā hē .9.

text: ਪੂੰਜੀ ਸਾਬਤੁ ਰਾਸਿ ਸਲਾਮਤਿ ਚੂਕਾ ਜਮ ਕਾ ਫਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: His stock is safe, and his capital is safe and sound. The noose of Death is cut away from around his neck. ||10||

transliteration.text: pūnjī sābat rās salāmat chūkā jam kā phāhā hē .10.
